notes: PV444 (1947-1958, 1940s coverage). Volvo's first mass-produced car after WWII. Unibody construction, independent front suspension. Fastback 2-door sedan design. Rear-wheel drive with inline-4 engine. Brass-era manufacturing techniques and vintage parts availability require specialized restoration expertise. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volvo PV444/544 article, January 2025 revision.

PV60 (1946-1950). Post-war continuation of pre-war PV models with updated styling. Large sedan with inline-6 engine. Rear-wheel drive. Separate body-on-frame construction. Vintage restoration requires specialized knowledge of 1940s automotive technology. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volvo PV60 article, January 2025 revision.
